radiographic_examinations.findings: Enlarged heart, small bilateral pleural effusions, patchy air-space disease with areas of patchy consolidation, thickenning of the interlobular septa bilaterally; no evidence of pulmonary embolism, aortic aneurysm, or pericardial effusion.

Endotracheal tube positioned 2 cm above the carina, enlarged heart, haziness over both costophrenic angles indicating small bilateral pleural effusions, patchy opacities in middle and lower lung zones consistent with pulmonary edema.

Dilated left ventricular cavity, severely impaired left ventricular systolic function with ejection fraction of 11%; hypokinetic left ventricular walls, incomplete closure of mitral valve leaflets, mild-to-moderate mitral regurgitation, dilated left atrium.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Ejection fraction improved to 46% at the 7-month follow-up visit; left ventricular size and left atrial size decreased and mitral regurgitation reduced.
